I'm following them on twitter (@japacurry)- and will pay them another visit when they around.

I would try the pork or chicken next time though.
author: aileen c.

description:
My first non-sushi review...probably won't be many...i've just been on a japanese curry craving lately!

You can see from all the reviews...its just plain ol good japanese curry!

Fairly priced and heavenly tasted. Good spices, crispy tonkatsu, over some fluffy brown rice. It hit the spot for sure!

and the truck decor definitely adds more flavor with my order. I'm a fan!

Another 4 stars added to their ratings.
author: .I I.

description: There is always a huge line for this place and I was really excited when I saw no line the other day (a holiday week). I rushed in, ordered some pork cutlet and waited. You wait for a bit and then you get your food like always, but what we got I could definitely tell was a bit reheated, overly cooked edges and sort of warm inside. ... The curry itself tasted pretty good but was really thin.  For the price I was a little disappointed. I know it's a truck, but you can't charge that much for food and then have it be sub par. Then again I might just be over the novelty of a truck in general for food.
author: Greg G.

description:
I tried the mild and it was spicy enough, but boy was it is so good! It was flavorful, savory, and rich with spices. I tasted a lot of garlic, too. The consistency was hearty--not too thin, not too thick--just right.

I've never had such good Japanese curry like this before, and I'm half Japanese! I'll definitely be back.
author: K. E.

description: The beef bento meat was so hard and sinewy it was like eating marinated rubber bands. I still have some wedged between my teeth so tight that I can't even floss it out.
author: Eddy S.

description:
W00t for the Chicken Katsu Curry!! Let's break it down:

Chicken - perfectly cooked. I mean perfectly - you can almost sense that the chicken just made the transition from raw to cooked. The breading was crispy and traditional panko and not greasy.

Curry gravy - I got it spicy. Super well-seasoned and delicious. The amount of sauce was just right in proportion to the other ingredients.

Pickles - yum, not sure if these were homemade however.

Rice - Plenty of it, however it was cold. Good thing the curry was there to heat it up.

Overall - $8 curry from a food truck that tastes way better than the stuff served in Japan town where you have to pay more. This is as good as it gets.
author: Richard Z.

description: This was my first time eating something from a food truck. What a nice experience! Staff was nice, food was very good, fresh, hot and perfect amount of food for lunch. I can't wait to get back there to try something else! I also bought an extra one for my husband for his lunch the next day and he enjoyed it! Just wished there was a restaurant to go to for dinner...
author: Kim F.

description: I got to OTG - Civic Center around 12: 20pm only to be disappointed that JapaCurry sold out of the Kurobuta sausage curry.  I was really looking forward to that dish.  Instead, I settled on my second choice, the pork cutlet.   Good portion of rice and cutlet, but the curry consistency was too watery for my liking.  I wish it had a bit more kick to it.
author: Stacey L.

description: This food truck is my newest favorite food truck ever! CurryUp has some serious competition for my money now. I just love this curry truck.  The curry is just spiced enough for flavor and kick.  It tasted so good i really wanted to lick my box after i was done with it.  The chicken was fried just right and it was so tender.  The rice was very good compared to other food trucks because its not too dry nor too mushy. its just right!
author: JC C.

description: Everytime I come, the bbq beef bento is sold out. My coworker and I went early, so I could get it. The beef was very flavorful, almost too much. It was a little too salty for me, but I also didn't eat all the rice with it. The beef was pretty chewy to me too. I think I would stick with the kara age  next time.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Winner!  I just had the spicy chicken katsu curry for lunch and the chicken katsu was perfect.  The chicken was tender and the breading was delicious and crispy.  I don't know, maybe it was so yummy to me because I was so hungry that I had the shakes.  Either way, I'll be heading back for the chicken katsu curry the next time they're at Pine and Sansome!
author: Lisa C.

description: Meh. Had great japanese curry before and had terrible japanese curry before.  This falls somewhere in the middle of the scale.
author: Yns S.

description:
Got the Katsu Curry with Pork.  My first experience with Japanese curry.  I asked for it spicy, but I couldn't really taste any heat to the curry.  The pork cutlet was breaded nicely and tasted fine, but nothing special.  The curry smelled amazing,  but the taste didn't deliver.  Kind of bland, which was surprising.  Nothing bad about the food, but nothing extraordinary.  

At $8, and nicely portioned, it's a decent lunch option if you're really wanting curry, but there are better places in the area.
author: Sam H.

description:
absolutely ichiban solid.

the japanese curry is homemade - evident from the bits of shallots and onion in the sauce. it's clear they controlled the consistency as well, because it did not get as thick as the "out-of-the-box" kind typically does, and there is a choice of spiciness!

choose from pork or chicken satsu, sausage, vegetable, or vegetable croquette - the curry that goes over it will be the same.

i opted for spicy, which was not that spicy, so if you like some zing, definitely go spicy.

the serving was HUGE. i am eating for one a quarter, and barely dented the rice. i did eat up all my veggies though and slurped up the curry.

keep hanging out on my office corner, JapaCurry!
author: Diana L.

description: Another great Japanese curry spot. Pork Katsu never fails to impress. The rice is fresh and the curry is just spicy enough. Do look out for it if it's on your block and go early or the line will pile up!
author: Z L.

description: well....I really like the soma district because there are so many food trucks everyday. Makes it easier for lunch....Japa Curry wasnt BAD but it wasn't that Great either. I think it's decent for a food truck........Prices were decent and they do give you a good amount for food. I had the katsu kurry and it was okay, my coworkers recommended the karaage curry so I guess i'll try that next time.
author: Colette P.

description: I dig it!  Cheap and tasty.  The menu price is what you pay.  I've only tried the chicken and the pork katsu.  The curry has good flavor and can come in a non spicy form.  The spicy form is just their curry sauce sprinkled in some kind of pepper powder.  If you're a fan of spiciness, I'd ask for super spicy(which really isn't that hot).  If i had to pick between the pork or chicken, i would go for the chicken.  Pork was just a tad bit tough.
author: Allen T.

description: Mm, I would have to award their curry as ~decent~. I was here for the Tofu Fest in Japantown SF when this truck caught my eye. My friends and I marveled at the cutesy design of the truck -- I wish all cars could be this adorably designed! The selection seemed pretty limited from only katsu curry to tofu or croquette curry. After munching on only tofu the whole morning, my carnivorous appetite went for the tonkatsu. For $7 the portion seemed on the slightly small side, but maybe I'm just a glutton. The meal was satisfying although not memorable. It didn't help that the pork katsu was pretty dry. I work at a curry place though so perhaps I'm just spoiled. It's cool though that there's a Japanese Curry Food Truck loose on the road to feed your curry cravings. They also advertised a Curry Burrito "Coming Soon" which I'm curious to try.
author: May N.

description: Very tasty curry and generous portions on the meat.  The katsu curry is fried well and doesn't get soggy at all in the to go box.  The line moves really quickly and you'll get your food within 5 mins of paying. So glad that they're now close to work at Pine and Sansome!
author: Amelia S.

description: Really authentic Japanese curry in a cute little food truck.  Even the containers look like the ones you'll find in Japan.  The curry itself is average restaurant-quality Japanese curry.  That's good given that they're a food truck, but at the same time there isn't anything really outstanding compared to other curry restaurants in the Bay Area.  I've gotta try their Curry pan (bread).
author: Durif M.

description: Had this when I was still working in the Financial District.  Not a fan of the Thai curry.  It seemed a little more Indian curry for me.  Definitely wasn't the taste I was expecting.  I was extremely hungry after lunch :(
author: Ang H.

description: Just had their Bento Box meals my crew and myself. Hands down..BEST Japanese food on wheels, craving for it now just thinking about it again. Just the right amount of portion and very filling for the price. Jay is an awesome cook that really loves what he does and it shows. Lots of care goes into the food prep and packaging. Is there a way to add a BONUS STAR?!
author: Khan N.

description: I miss this truck - it hasn't come by in a while.  Their curry is really really good.  I love that it comes in a separate little container so that if you want to eat half and save the rest for later, it all heats up nicely.  I usually get the tonkatsu which is delish.  This place usually sells out so if you see it, get in line fast!
author: Doris L.

description: Great food.  Had the Pumpkin and Veggie Croquette Curry.  A healthy portion for 8.50 (inclusive of a bottle of water).  The curry is delicious, with kick but not too much.  This is lunch after all.  The pumpkin croquettes are amazing with rich pumpkin flavor.  I wanted another order immediately, except I ate too much rice.  Minus a star for not having any disposals anywhere around the truck, something I think all these food trucks should be taking some level of responsibility for (though I also think the City should do a better job with this as well)
author: Jeremy B.

description: Loved this truck!  My favorite down here for katsucurry in the FiDi is Muracci's, but this truck was just as good.  The pork and chicken are both delicious.  On point!  The people who run it are also very nice and friendly.  I'm down like james brown for this joint.
author: Big Daddy C.

description: Completely agree with Fannie S. below. Muracci's is a better product. Solid meal but just lacking the depth of flavor as offered by Muracci's. Too expensive as well particularly for a truck.
author: Dave C.

description:
Everything else but the katsu curry was sold out for lunch today. I find that completely strange since the signature entree is the curry. Bentos are "fake" Japanese food so avoid those! For $8, the choice was either chicken or pork katsu with rice. Brown rice is an additional $.50. Curry sauce is either regular or spicy. 

Don't forget to BadgeIn with your Clipper card for frequent dining "points"/perks per visit! The wait was a little over 5 minutes which was a bit longer than I expected considering that there was no one before me. I believe white rice was out so I got brown rice for no charge, score. The spicy curry sauce comes separate in a plastic bowl but the only significant difference is a few drops of chili sauce. My friend got the same thing except she didn't want the spicy curry sauce. I felt that my spicy curry wasn't really spicy but she thought her regular sauce was spicy. It really depends on what you are used to (the amount of spicy-ness). The value was ok for what you get but I wish more rice would be included. I had to finish half of her share since I was still not bloated. The pork katsu was excellent. I had Volcano Curry a few days ago and the pork meat was fried much better and the quality of the meat was higher as well. Definitely should not skip out on this!
author: Dominic T.

description: I love curry and this place is the best I've had in awhile.  Definitely the best food truck out there right now!  I tried the chicken katsu curry and it was perfectly made. I tried the mild curry but I think i'll be brave and go for spicy next time.
author: James W.

description: 3.5 stars.  I enjoyed the chicken katsu with spicy curry, over brown rice.  It actually had a nice kick to it.  The portion was large and the price was reasonable.  Even though my stomach was all stretched out from my all inclusive vacation, I still couldn't finish it.  I'd get it again
author: Seong P.

description: Finally got to the JapaCurry truck at the Civic Center. Had the tonkatsu (pork) curry, which is $8. Loved it. Got the spicy curry, but it's actually not that spicy. Rich, dark brown curry sauce that comes in a separate container. Rushed back to my cubicle, slathered the curry all over my tonkatsu and my rice. Was still licking the take-out box, trying to savor every last drop. Nice comfort food meal. Now, I just want to crawl beneath my desk and sleep.
author: David Y.

description: If you like Japanese Curry that takes more than 24 hours to cook down the ingredients into heaven, and are too lazy to call in an order to Murrachi's and walk there to get it, then find this truck.
author: Jim L.

description: Tasty ! I had Kurobuta sausage curry at OTG UN plaza today.The curry sauce has deep flavor of well-cooked vegetables with just a right amount of spiciness. Kurobuta sausage has nice and crispy texture when you bite into and not greasy. May be a bit of vegetable pickles or something  to add a color to the dish would be perfect ! I already committed to try their Chicken Nanban Bento next time. Can't wait !
author: Kana Y.

description: The best Japanese curry in the city.  Definitely worth chasing down!
author: Corey C.

description: Caught the truck in FiDi last week for an instant meal; it's so worth chasing them because just the katsu curry pork alone with their spicy curry over white rice is incredibly tasty. I mean, I don't mind spending $8 for lunch especially since I literally have to find out their whereabouts via Twitter. Count me in as another fan!
author: Mika D.

description: Yum. Just what i needed. Veggies were done to perfection (not too soft nor too hard) and the sauce was delicious. I asked for spicy and it was slightly spicy (not too spicy) so if you REALLY like spicy then maybe asking for EXTRA spicy is the way to go. The flavor was phenomenal and the pumpkin croquette was a nice sweet treat to have as part of it. Definitely will have this again - may become a lunch staple for me.
author: michelle c.

description: Meh.  I expected more, to be honest.  I got the spicy sausage and curry and while it was decent, it wasn't anything to be excited about.  The pumpkin croquette and curry sounded delicious, though.  Maybe I just got the wrong thing.
author: Jessica H.

description: Delicious curry. The curry isn't strong nor heavy. If you like Japanese curry then this is a good place. The price was a little more than expected, but for genuine good authentic Japanese curry... it doesn't matter.
author: Sonlay V.

description: I got their chicken katsu curry today again and asked for it to be super spicy. What a let down again. Although the curry wasn't spicy it was decent. I was truly disappointed today because almost everything was sold out and it was only 12:05PM!!! I wanted to give other things a try because last week, I did not like their Teriyaki chicken bento. I ordered and they hand it to be right away. At the time I thought it was cool... already made and ready to eat. It took me 3 minutes from the Truck to my desk... and the food the freaking COLD!!! I had to wait in line for the microwave to heat up my food that I just bought... It should have been hot or at least warm and ready to eat. I really wanted to give this place a try again. So far the katsu was decent and haven't really tried anything else. I will update my review once I tried other bento.
author: Nokie N.

description:
i *thought* this place was good, but after a catered lunch from here for 100 or so people at my company, i am even more impressed! 

have come here twice on my own, as it is only a half block away from my work on tuesdays. ordered the pork katsu both times. i was already amazed at the crispness of the katsu, being from a truck and warming in a cardboard container and everything...

but their catered food is even crispy! how is that possible?! however they do it, i'm so grateful. i got my lunch at 12, and my coworker said the truck arrived with food at 11. WOTTTTT?!!!!

anyways, the pork katsu has great pork flavor, and the curry is not as sweet as i imagined japanese curry to be, but for me, i think that's a good thing. 

make sure to mix the red pickly things into your curry rice. the little bit of zing and crunch boosts the flavor and makes it feel lighter.

btw, you can order a side of veggie croquette ($1.50) instead of getting the entree. :) i'm not that big a fan, but then again, i'm not a big fan of pumpkin.

ask for a buy 12 get the 13th free card too!
author: Melissa C.

description: Yum. This was the perfect katsu curry lunch. The serving size was huge and the pork katsu was perfectly fried. Decently priced. All in all, no complaints.
author: Alli J.

description: I Can't Get Enough. I hate vegetables usually and this place doesn't serve any with the Chicken Katsu. The Sauce is Hella Good and comes seperate so you can dunk or poor or both. I vouch for this place.
author: Ian D.

description: I'm happy this food truck came by my office today. I tried the Kurobuta sausage curry plate and it was super tasty. I'm looking forward to trying the Katsu curries! Yummm.
author: David D.

description: Tried this place when it was parked by my work at Howard and First.  Very yummy chicken katsu curry.  The chicken was very moist and light.  Curry sauce light too but flavorful and tasty, the way I like it.   Delicious lunch.  It would be even better if there was a some veggies in the mix.
author: Kailee Q.

description: A lot of ppl like comparing this place to Muracci's on Kearny since it's relatively nearby...it's a fair matchup, but JapaCurry gets the nod for their taste and prices.  Their spicy curry is better made w/ its thinly sliced onions and thicker texture.  It could've been more spicy, but it's hot enough for the average bear.  The chicken/pork katsu has a thinner layer of fried batter as well, and goes great w/ the curry.  A meal comes w/ a heaping bed of white rice and a small bit of pickled radish for $8.  They also have a sausage curry combo for $8.  If you want strictly meat, get the katsu combo.  If you want more of a mixture of veggies and meat, get the sausage combo as that comes w/ carrots and bell peppers.  This place is definitely top 3 in SF when it comes to Japanese curry, check it!
author: Jeff S.

description: I had a pumpkin croquette, which wasn't bad.  Unique taste was good - unlike other things that I've had.
author: Charles C.

description: The food tasted good but there was almost nothing but rice in the box when I opened it.  I got the pumpkin corquette with veggies and there were only 3 bits of vegetables and about 2 pounds of rice.  I won't be going back again.  I can think of better ways of spending $8.
author: suzanne c.

description: The kurobuta sausage curry was pretty good, thee smallish links in a really good sauce over white rice.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Japanese Curry, who knew?!? Loved the chicken katsu, flavorful breaded chicken with sticky rice and tasty-but-not-too-spicy brown curry sauce. I stare at the truck from my office window, and no big lunch lines yet.
author: Peter H.

description:
Once I found out that they were out at New Montgomery and Mission...I headed right out there.. 12:35PM.. line was super long.. about 25 or so ppl..line did move fast though (15 min).. and the food was given to us quick.. 

I had the chicken katsu curry..the chicken was great.. fried perfect.. the curry was yummy..although, I did chose spicy..it wasn't..just a tiny bit.. 

overall, I love my meal..would totally go back!
author: Linda Y.

description: Solid lunch option. Beware, they are now cash only.
author: Scoot S.

description: About 15 minutes in line when I got there at 11:25am, but you get your food quickly once you order. I had the kurobuta sausage curry and it was the perfect size for me and the spiciness was just right. Especially on the slightly grey chilly day in SF today, it was the ideal comfort food. I'll have to try the other varieties soon, I'm glad there's a food truck near work... I was getting tired of the same few places.
author: Amy C.

description: I'm a big fan of JapaCurry.  I have tried most of their curry dishes as well as the nori bento box - All are very delicious!  Their curry has depth of flavor, their rice is made to perfection, and their chicken katsu tender and not greasy.  I try and go every Thursday to Mission and Montgomery.  I love that the lunch staff are Japanese expatriates.
author: Dana G.

description: Waiting patiently on Thursday for the JapaCurry truck to start business.  And was it ever worth the 10 minute wait!  Chicken Katsu is seriously amazing.  The care he puts into the food AND the curry on the side...PERFECT touch.  I even brought home the pork katsu for dinner for the hubby, and believe it or not, it traveled well.  Hubby gave it a "4 star" review as well, so is that 8 stars?  Run; do not walk!  Try it...you will NOT be disappointed!
author: Sonia C.

description: Very, very good. I've had the chicken katsu and pork katsu. Both were well prepared, tender, and flavorful. But the curry... ohhh, the curry is fabulous. I can taste it now. It's MUCH better than the boxed curries you get at Japanese grocery stores, even after kicking it up with jalapenos and additional spices. They offer regular and spicy; the spicy is noticeably spicy, but not mouth-burningly hot. Regular is probably bland by comparison. The only drawback is that this is a truck, so there's nowhere to eat. You have to carry it elsewhere, or sit on the sidewalk.
author: Stuart M.

description:
This place is so disappointing.  I ordered the spicy vegetable curry.  It only came with three pieces of grilled vegetable: one slice of eggplant, one thin slice of green pepper, and one asparagus, and some curry sauce and rice.   But they charged $7 for it.  They should give a little more vegetables.  

The curry was not that amazing.  It tastes like the curry blocks you can buy from any Asian superstore.  They just added some onions.  

For $7 lunch, I am very disappointed.  I could spent this amount in any restaurants nearby and get way better quality food.
author: Jessica L.

description: Beautiful, amazing, satisfying katsu chicken curry. Simply one of the finest curry experiences of my life. Thank you.
author: J C.

description:
my go-to lunch recently. i fiend for japa.

order like this. it's kinda douchey, but worth it:

chicken katsu, extra curry, spicy, veggies with no potatoes, half rice.

it almost feels like a balanced meal.
author: Andy P.

description: I brought lunch to work, but heard that they were just down the street from me.  So I had to go and check them out.  The line was kind of long but it moves.  I managed to snag the last chicken katsu curry.  The usual lunch places around 2nd and Mission are just ok and gets boring.  I'll definitely be keeping an eye out for them when they are back on Weds and Thurs.
author: BM G.

description: If you see this truck, RUN, don't walk towards it.  I thought I had the best japanese curry there was, eating at Muracci's, but boy was I wrong.  It happened like it usually happens, I hear about this new place on New Montgomery called Sushiritto (which by the way I will be reviewing on soon) and go there to see what the hype is about because hey, let's face it food makes me happy.  Anywho, I go and the line is not just out the door, it's out the door, around the corner and down that block.  Some people had sleeping bags!  One guy tried to cut in line and the old lady behind him hip tossed him to the curb.  Ok, I made up the sleeping bag part.  Well, I wasn't ready to wait a couple of days for a sushi burrito yet, so we leave and there it was, around the corner.  The line was long but compared to the other place, it seemed like a firecracker fuse compared to a bungie cord (on a very high bridge, that stretches and, well you get the point).  We all tried the katsu curry, and oh boy was it katsu-licious.  Sorry I'll stop.  Bottom line, best japanese curry yet!  Follow it, and if it's in your neighborhood, RUN TOWARDS IT.
author: Tony N.

description: OK, being half Japanese, yet totally haku, I stumbled upon these guys by accident.  They didn't fail me.  The Katsu was perfect and the curry had a great kick without being overbearing... and over brown rice which I ordered.  Five stars for the memories of my childhood and five stars for today!  If you see these guys in the FiDi, don't hesitate!
author: nick p.

description: Had nanban chicken at fort mason otg. tasty, fast, good service.
author: Wangston P.

description: had this at off the grid at fort mason. Good chicken katsu curry at a very nice price.
author: Steve C.

description: I love the concept of the food truck! It's all about the food and the experience of finding a good spot to eat your food. Since I love Japanese curry, I had to try this one. Arrived just before the noon lunch rush at the howard location, and glad I did. Barely stood in line, and found a great shaded stump to sit and eat. A friend and I had a great time eating, talking, and enjoying the beautiful weather while eating our pork katsu curry (both ordered to be spicy!). I'm definitely trying this again. First, to try the other items on the menu (there are about 7-8 different options), and then have the pork katsu curry again. The pork was moist, and perfectly crisp.
author: Sooji H.

description: I came here with one of my co-workers awhile ago.  We didn't know what to order, but one of the workers named Yoshi is actually from Japan and speaks great English.  He helped us and we had the chicken and pork. Customer service on a food truck is not common, so we will surely come again!
author: Antonio V.
